alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 11:40AM CST until March 17 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri...Arkansas... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville affecting Pemiscot, New Madrid and Lake Counties. Mississippi River at Osceola affecting Mississippi, Tipton and Lauderdale Counties. Mississippi River at Caruthersville affecting Pemiscot, Dyer, Mississippi, Lake and Lauderdale Counties. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Osceola. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, In Tennessee, Nix road is flooded. Major sections of Four Mile Road are flooded. Snyder Bluff and northern Sam Taylor Roads are flooding. Sunk Lake Road is covered north of Bee Lake. Fields on Morgan Point are flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 30.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CST Thursday was 30.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.0 feet tomorrow morning, March 11. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon, March 16. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.5 feet on 03/01/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM CST.
